thread.title: Freitas-Eagan, Gallagher deliver on home course
thread.title_full: Freitas-Eagan, Gallagher deliver on home course

author: Reformer Staff
title: Freitas-Eagan, Gallagher deliver on home course
text:
Freitas-Eagan, Gallagher deliver on home course 
Reformer Staff Posted: 09/30/2015 07:24:28 PM EDT Updated: 09/30/2015 07:24:30 PM EDT Click photo to enlarge Stratton, BBA, MAU, Brattleboro and Hartford runners compete in the girls varsity race on Tuesday at the course on East Orchard Street. « 2 » 
BRATTLEBORO >> The Brattleboro Union High School boys and girls cross-country teams finished second and fourth respectively in Tuesday's home meet on the East Orchard Street course. 
Brattleboro's Isaac Freitas-Eagan barely missed winning the boys race as he was edged by Kameron Hussain of Stratton Mountain School by one second. Josh Meachen and Jonah Koch also placed in the Top 10 for the Colonels while Colin Costa-Walsh and Trevor Kipp rounded out the team's scoring. 
In the girls' race, Kathryn Ogden of SMS ran away from the field and showed why she is one of the top runners in the state — finishing in 20:33 and barely missing the course record of 20:20 set in 2010 by Mary Kate Cirelli of Rutland. Sarah Gallagher paced the Brattleboro girls by placing third and equaling her personal best time of 22:20. Catey Yost ran well and placed 11th, followed by Emilia Dick-Fiora, Mollie Patenaude and Annie Takacs. 
The Brattleboro teams will travel to Thetford on Saturday for the Woods Trail run, where 1,500 runners are expected. Brattleboro Boys Results
